Migrate task-dashboard from tmux/Perl to Kitty session
description:
Current: Perl script managing tmux sessions (bin/task-dashboard)
Target: Kitty session file + watcher script for auto-refresh

Benefits:
- Native GPU-accelerated rendering (no tmux overhead)
- Simpler config (kitty session format)
- Better macOS integration
- Auto-refresh via file watcher

Implementation:
1. Create config/kitty/sessions/taskwarrior.kitty-session
2. Define layout: next report, today view, burndown, timew summary, tasksh
3. Write Bun watcher script to refresh on task changes
4. Hook watcher into taskwarrior on-modify hook
5. Add launcher alias (task-dashboard or similar)

Note: Kitty session only (local macOS use), auto-refresh is critical requirement

Pi settings.json has JSON comments that cause parse errors on NUC
description: The nix-managed settings.json at config/pi/settings.json uses // comments which are not valid JSON. Pi shows warning: 'Invalid JSON in /home/emiller/.pi/agent/settings.json: SyntaxError'. Options: 1) Convert to JSONC and check if pi supports it, 2) Strip comments for NUC deployment, 3) Use a separate settings file for headless/server deployments.
notes: FINDING: Pi docs confirm 'Pi uses JSON settings files' - standard JSON only, no JSONC support. Solution: Strip comments from config/pi/settings.json or create a comment-stripped version for deployment.
close_reason: Fixed: pi module now uses pure nix to strip // comments from settings.json during deployment. Comments preserved in source for documentation, valid JSON deployed to NUC.

Create tmux-gitu package with smart VCS detection
description:
# tmux-gitu Package Design

## Overview
Create a tmux plugin package that provides popup-based git TUI with smart VCS detection.
- **gitu** for git repositories
- **jjui** for jj repositories (when available)

## Architecture

### File Structure
```
packages/tmux-gitu/
├── default.nix           # Nix package definition
├── tmux-gitu.tmux        # Main tmux plugin entry
└── scripts/
    ├── helpers.sh        # Tmux option helper
    ├── open-git-tui.sh   # Smart launcher (detects VCS type)
    ├── open-gitu.sh      # Direct gitu launcher
    └── open-jjui.sh      # Direct jjui launcher
```

### Smart VCS Detection Logic

`scripts/open-git-tui.sh`:
```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
CURRENT_PATH="$(tmux display-message -p "#{pane_current_path}")"

# Detect VCS type
if [ -d "$CURRENT_PATH/.jj" ]; then
  VCS_TUI="jjui"
elif [ -d "$CURRENT_PATH/.git" ] || git -C "$CURRENT_PATH" rev-parse --git-dir >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  VCS_TUI="gitu"
else
  # Fallback to gitu if no VCS detected
  VCS_TUI="gitu"
fi

# Launch in popup
tmux display-popup -d "$CURRENT_PATH" -xC -yC -w80% -h80% -E "$VCS_TUI"
```

### Keybindings
- `G` - Smart launcher (auto-detects jj vs git)
- Optional: Direct launchers if user wants explicit control

### Nix Package

```nix
{ lib, stdenvNoCC, makeWrapper, gitu, jjui ? null }:

stdenvNoCC.mkDerivation rec {
  pname = "tmux-gitu";
  version = "0.1.0";

  src = ./.;

  nativeBuildInputs = [ makeWrapper ];

  installPhase = ''
    mkdir -p $out/share/tmux-plugins/tmux-gitu
    cp -r * $out/share/tmux-plugins/tmux-gitu/
    
    # Wrap scripts with TUIs in PATH
    for script in $out/share/tmux-plugins/tmux-gitu/scripts/*.sh; do
      wrapProgram "$script" \
        --prefix PATH : ${lib.makeBinPath ([ gitu ] ++ lib.optional (jjui != null) jjui)}
    done
    
    chmod +x $out/share/tmux-plugins/tmux-gitu/tmux-gitu.tmux
  '';

  meta = with lib; {
    description = "Smart tmux popup for git TUIs (gitu/jjui)";
    platforms = platforms.unix;
  };
}
```

### Integration

In `config/tmux/config`:
```tmux
# Load plugin
run-shell ${pkgs.tmux-gitu}/share/tmux-plugins/tmux-gitu/tmux-gitu.tmux

# Customize keybinding (optional)
set -g @open-git-tui 'G'  # Smart launcher
```

## Implementation Notes

1. **VCS Detection Priority:**
   - Check `.jj` directory first (jj repos)
   - Fall back to `.git` or `git rev-parse` (git repos)
   - Default to gitu if no VCS detected

2. **Popup Behavior:**
   - Centered (-xC -yC)
   - 80% width/height
   - Uses current pane's directory
   - `-E` flag closes popup on command exit

3. **jjui Integration:**
   - Optional dependency (jjui ? null)
   - Gracefully degrades if jjui unavailable
   - Only included in PATH if provided

4. **Future Enhancements:**
   - Toggle behavior (close if already open)
   - Configurable popup size
   - Support for other TUIs (tig, lazygit, etc.)
   - Per-project TUI preferences

## Why Package vs Inline?

**Inline approach (current):**
```tmux
bind G display-popup -d "#{pane_current_path}" -xC -yC -w80% -h80% -E gitu
```

**Package approach (this design):**
- Reusable across configs
- Smart VCS detection
- Easier to extend with more TUIs
- Toggle behavior possible
- Consistent interface for multiple tools

## Decision

**Current:** Use inline approach for simplicity.
**Future:** Implement package when jjui support becomes important or when more features needed (toggle, multi-TUI support, etc.).

Benefits:
- Faster runtime (Bun vs Python)
- Native JSON handling
- Modern TypeScript with type safety
- Simpler dependency management

Implementation:
1. Rewrite hook in TypeScript with bunx shebang
2. Port subprocess calls to Bun.spawn()
3. Add types for taskwarrior/timewarrior data structures
4. Update nix module to install new hook
5. Test with actual task start/stop workflow

Report nix-clawdbot NixOS compatibility issues upstream
description:
nix-clawdbot has several NixOS incompatibilities:

1. Uses hardcoded /bin/* paths (mkdir, ln, cat, rm) which don't exist on NixOS
2. Wrapper script uses bare 'cat' command without ensuring PATH includes coreutils
3. Most plugins have darwin-only dependencies (bird, sag, summarize, gogcli, oracle, poltergeist, imsg, camsnap, peekaboo)

Workarounds applied in dotfiles:
- system.activationScripts.binCompat creates /bin symlinks
- systemd.user.sessionVariables.PATH adds /bin to PATH
- All plugins disabled on NUC

File issue at: https://github.com/... (find correct repo)

title: Tag NUC for Tailscale Services and redeploy opencode
description:
Tag NUC with tag:server so it can host Tailscale Services, then redeploy opencode.

## Steps

1. **Add tag to ACL policy** (Tailscale Admin → Access Controls):
   ```json
   {
     "tagOwners": {
       "tag:server": ["autogroup:admin"]
     }
   }
   ```

2. **Create tagged auth key** (Settings → Keys → Generate):
   - Reusable: optional
   - Tags: tag:server

3. **Re-register NUC with tag**:
   ```bash
   ssh nuc
   sudo tailscale logout
   sudo tailscale up --auth-key=tskey-auth-xxxxx --advertise-tags=tag:server
   ```

4. **Verify tag**: `tailscale status` should show tag:server

5. **Redeploy**: `hey nuc`

## Result
OpenCode accessible at https://opencode.<tailnet>.ts.net with TLS
close_reason: Completed: NUC tagged with tag:server, Tailscale Service working at tcp://opencode.cinnamon-rooster.ts.net:4096

title: Batch ps calls — single subprocess for all panes
description: rename takes ~500ms due to per-pane ps + tmux capture-pane forks. Batch into one ps -a call, cache results, reuse across panes. Target: <100ms.
close_reason: Batched ps into single call, batched tmux list-panes -a. 800ms -> 200ms (4x). Remaining time is capture-pane for agent status.

title: Add pi-specific status patterns
description: pi TUI has different patterns than opencode. Detect pi idle (prompt line), busy (tool execution, streaming), waiting (permission prompts), error states. Test against real pi pane captures.
close_reason: Added pi patterns: Working... spinner, Steering:, status bar (anthropic/openai/google), cost line, LSP. Tested against real captures.

title: Add Claude Code-specific status patterns
description: Claude Code CLI has its own TUI patterns. Detect idle (prompt with >), busy (streaming text, tool calls with ⎿), waiting (permission prompts like 'Allow once?'), error. Current patterns partially work but aren't tested against real captures.
close_reason: Added Claude Code patterns: ⎿ tool marker, Esc to cancel, Calling tool, prompt >, token usage, How can I help. Tests with real output.

title: Add OpenCode-specific status patterns
description: OpenCode TUI uses specific patterns: 'ctrl+p commands' footer for idle, spinner chars for busy, progress bars. Current patterns are OpenCode-focused but not rigorously tested. Capture real pane output and add regression tests.
close_reason: Added OpenCode patterns: ≋ streaming, ■■■ progress, esc interrupt, ctrl+p/ctrl+t footer, version string. Tests included.

title: Remove redundant opencodeStatus bash script
description: modules/shell/tmux/default.nix has a ~100-line opencodeStatus bash function appended to status-right. tmux-smart-name now handles all agent status detection. Remove the bash version and its status-right integration.

title: Add periodic status refresh timer
description: Status only updates on tmux hook events (window switch, split, etc). Agent going busy->idle->waiting won't show until user switches windows. Add a tmux timer (every 5-10s) that re-runs --run for the current window only.

title: Fix multi-pane window naming (ssh + pi)
description: Window 2 has both an ssh pane and a pi pane. Active pane is pi so name shows 'pi: ~/.c/dotfiles'. When ssh pane is active, it should show 'ssh' or 'ssh: host'. Currently only checks active pane program, ignoring inactive agent panes for naming (status icons still aggregate correctly).

title: OpenCode TUI crashes over SSH on NixOS NUC
description:
OpenCode TUI (libopentui.so) crashes with SIGABRT when running over SSH on headless NixOS server (NUC).

**Upstream Issue:** https://github.com/sst/opencode/issues/6119

**Symptoms:**
- Immediate crash on TUI initialization
- SIGABRT signal from bun/libopentui.so
- Works fine with `opencode serve` (headless mode)
- Affects OpenCode 1.0.224 + Bun 1.3.5

**Environment:**
- NixOS 26.05 (hardened kernel 6.12.56)
- SSH session (no local console)
- TERM and TERMINFO_DIRS set correctly

**Workarounds:**
1. Use `opencode serve` for headless API mode
2. Access NUC via VNC/console directly
3. Run OpenCode locally with sshfs mount

**Status:** Waiting for upstream fix in opentui library.

title: bugwarrior: Add post_import hook support
description:
Bugwarrior only supports pre_import hooks which run BEFORE tasks are synced to Taskwarrior. Need post_import hook to run commands AFTER import completes.

Use case: Automatically mark Linear Triage/Backlog tasks as waiting, auto-complete Done tasks.

Current workaround: Added post-import logic to bugwarrior-pull-cached wrapper script.

Upstream: Consider opening issue at https://github.com/ralphbean/bugwarrior

title: Setup trackwarrior - link taskwarrior to timewarrior for time tracking

Install and configure trackwarrior (https://github.com/gkssjovi/trackwarrior) to link taskwarrior and timewarrior. Displays time spent on tasks in a new column.

3. Add UDA config to taskrc
4. Update report columns to show time tracking

title: Add worktree helpers for jj - port DHH's agent-git-trees
description:
Port DHH's git worktree helper script (https://gist.github.com/dhh/18575558fc5ee10f15b6cd3e108ed844) to use jj instead of git.

Original functions:
- ga <branch>: Create worktree + branch, cd into it
- gd: Remove worktree + branch from within active worktree

JJ equivalent:
- ja <name>: Create jj workspace, cd into it  
- jd: Remove workspace from within active workspace

Note: jj uses 'workspace' instead of worktree, different workflow but similar concept.
notes: Implemented in 9f2afcc6 refactor(jw): move to packages/ with modular structure
